qas.question: What's the year that Jersey Dutch was last spoken, according to records?
What Dutch-based language popped up in the area of Albany, New York?
What's a more accurate name for Pennsylvania Dutch since it's not a Dutch dialect?
Which Dutch dialect was once spoken in the U.S. Virgin Islands?
In what country were the Berbice and Skepi dialects spoken?

context: In the United States, an almost extinct dialect of Dutch, Jersey Dutch, spoken by descendants of 17th-century Dutch settlers in Bergen and Passaic counties, was still spoken as late as <a0_0>1921<a0_0/>. Other Dutch-based creole languages once spoken in the Americas include <a1_0>Mohawk Dutch<a1_0/> (in Albany, New York), Berbice (in <a4_0>Guyana<a4_0/>), Skepi (in Essequibo, Guyana) and <a3_0>Negerhollands<a3_0/> (in the United States Virgin Islands). Pennsylvania Dutch is not a member of the set of Dutch dialects and is less misleadingly called <a2_0>Pennsylvania German<a2_0/>.
